member.name: T:Revit.SDK.Samples.TraverseSystem.CS.Command
member.summary: Implements the Revit add-in interface IExternalCommand

member.name: M:Revit.SDK.Samples.TraverseSystem.CS.Command.Execute(Autodesk.Revit.UI.ExternalCommandData,System.String@,Autodesk.Revit.DB.ElementSet)
member.summary: Implement this method as an external command for Revit.
member.param: An object that is passed to the external application which contains data related to the command, such as the application object and active view.
A message that can be set by the external application which will be displayed if a failure or cancellation is returned by the external command.
A set of elements to which the external application can add elements that are to be highlighted in case of failure or cancellation.
member.returns: Return the status of the external command. A result of Succeeded means that the API external method functioned as expected. Cancelled can be used to signify that the user cancelled the external operation at some point. Failure should be returned if the application is unable to proceed with the operation.

member.name: M:Revit.SDK.Samples.TraverseSystem.CS.Command.ExtractMechanicalOrPipingSystem(Autodesk.Revit.DB.Element)
member.summary: Get the mechanical or piping system from selected element
member.returns: The extracted mechanical or piping system. Null if no expected system is found.

member.name: M:Revit.SDK.Samples.TraverseSystem.CS.Command.ExtractSystemFromConnectors(Autodesk.Revit.DB.ConnectorSet)
member.summary: Get the mechanical or piping system from the connectors of selected element
member.returns: The found mechanical or piping system

member.name: T:Revit.SDK.Samples.TraverseSystem.CS.TreeNode
member.summary: A TreeNode object represents an element in the system

member.summary: Id of the element

member.name: F:Revit.SDK.Samples.TraverseSystem.CS.TreeNode.m_direction
member.summary: Flow direction of the node For the starting element of the traversal, the direction will be the same as the connector connected to its following element; Otherwise it will be the direction of the connector connected to its previous element

member.name: F:Revit.SDK.Samples.TraverseSystem.CS.TreeNode.m_parent
member.summary: The parent node of the current node.

member.name: F:Revit.SDK.Samples.TraverseSystem.CS.TreeNode.m_inputConnector
member.summary: The connector of the previous element to which current element is connected

member.summary: The first-level child nodes of the current node
